title: Fundamentals of Protein-Small Molecule Interaction Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in biochemistry and molecular biology, understanding of protein structures, and basic computer literacy
context.additional_context: Basic education on protein-small molecule interaction modeling using smartphone-based microlearning platforms. Mobile-optimized content provided for environments without PCs

learning_goals: The fundamental principles of protein-small molecule interaction modeling can be explained.
Structural diversity of protein-ligand complexes can be analyzed using a graph neural network (PLACER)-based tool.
Ensemble structures generated through modeling can be interpreted to evaluate heterogeneity in molecular interactions.

resources: Access to Protein-Small Molecule Interaction Databases (PDB/CSD)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
